docs.lead_paragraph: Are we fat because we overeat, or do we overeat because we’re fat?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by pediatrics Prof David S Ludwig and Nutrition Science Initiative executive Mark I Friedman describes how their study, published in The Journal of the American Medical Association, suggests that people overeat because they are overweight, rather than the other way around; offers ways that research can be improved and adjusted to test this hypothesis.
docs.snippet: Are we fat because we overeat, or do we overeat because we’re fat?

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By DAVID S. LUDWIG and MARK I. FRIEDMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmie Johnson proved he can do more than win NASCAR races.

headline.main: Johnson Completes Triathlon Before All-Star Race

docs.lead_paragraph: Industrial blenders mix up smoothies for students in New York while some schools in California are adding salad bars. In Dallas, campus cafeterias use pass-through coolers and warmers to make sure the food is just right before it's served.

headline.main: Schools Seek Upgrades to Entice Healthy Eating
headline.print_headline: Schools Seek Upgrades to Entice Healthy Eating

docs.snippet: Industrial blenders mix up smoothies for students in New York while some schools in California are adding salad bars. In Dallas, campus cafeterias use pass-through coolers and warmers to make sure the food is just right before it's served.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kurt Busch commanded his driver to step on the gas before the UPS truck sped away. Inside, he was hoping for a package from Italy holding the $2,495 firesuit he'll need for his latest — and wildest — racing endeavor.

headline.main: Busch Looks to Reinvent Himself With 'The Double'
headline.print_headline: Busch Looks to Reinvent Himself With 'The Double'

docs.snippet: Kurt Busch commanded his driver to step on the gas before the UPS truck sped away. Inside, he was hoping for a package from Italy holding the $2,495 firesuit he'll need for his latest — and wildest — racing endeavor.

docs.lead_paragraph: Multigenerational ventures defy the stereotype about younger and older people battling over jobs in the still-shaky economy.

headline.main: Partnerships That Blend the Skills of Two Generations
headline.print_headline: Partnerships That Blend the Skills of Two Generations

docs.abstract: Business ventures between younger and older partners are defying persistent stereotypes about battles over jobs in shaky economy; different skill sets among multigenerational individuals are proving to have merit, often revealing themselves as secrets to success of businesses.
docs.snippet: Multigenerational ventures defy the stereotype about younger and older people battling over jobs in the still-shaky economy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A survey found that the loss of managed honeybee colonies from all causes has dropped to 23.2 percent nationwide over the winter that just ended, down from 30.5 percent the year before.

headline.main: Report Says Fewer Bees Perished Over the Winter, but the Reason Is a Mystery
headline.print_headline: Report Says Fewer Bees Perished Over the Winter, but the Reason Is a Mystery

docs.abstract: Survey of beekeepers conducted by Agriculture Department and Bee Informed Partnership finds that loss of managed honeybee colonies from all causes fell to 23.2 percent nationwide over 2013-14 winter, down from 30.5 percent year before.
docs.snippet: A survey found that the loss of managed honeybee colonies from all causes has dropped to 23.2 percent nationwide over the winter that just ended, down from 30.5 percent the year before.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly one out of four American honeybee colonies died this winter — a loss that's not quite as bad as recent years, says a new U.S. Department of Agriculture survey of beekeepers.

headline.main: Fed Survey: 23% of Bee Colonies Died This Winter
headline.print_headline: Fed Survey: 23% of Bee Colonies Died This Winter

docs.snippet: Nearly one out of four American honeybee colonies died this winter — a loss that's not quite as bad as recent years, says a new U.S. Department of Agriculture survey of beekeepers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mets first baseman Lucas Duda and the Philadelphia Phillies manager Ryne Sandberg said they got sick over the weekend after eating at Shake Shack.

headline.main: Complaints of Food Poisoning at Citi Field Restaurant Don’t Scare Off Customers
headline.print_headline: Complaints of Food Poisoning at Citi Field Restaurant Don’t Scare Off Customers

docs.abstract: Mets first baseman Lucas Duda and Philadelphia Phillies manager Ryne Sandberg say they got sick after eating at Shake Shack at Citi Field; Mets management says it does not believe tainted burgers came from stadium; Shake Shack releases statement saying it is looking into report.
docs.snippet: Mets first baseman Lucas Duda and the Philadelphia Phillies manager Ryne Sandberg said they got sick over the weekend after eating at Shake Shack.
